message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This analysis utilizes the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the Doing Business dataset to explore the relationship between access to finance and business performance in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Doing Business"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We use a combination of satellite imagery data from NASA, administrative data from local governments, and household survey data to analyze land use changes and their impacts on local ecosystems in Central America.", "dataset": ["NASA satellite imagery data", "administrative data from local governments", "household survey data"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This study leverages transaction-level data from the Chicago Board of Trade and New York Mercantile Exchange to test whether carbon emissions trading has contributed to reductions in greenhouse gas emissions in the United States.", "dataset": ["Chicago Board of Trade", "New York Mercantile Exchange"], "topic": ["Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey and the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent to Adult Health, we examine the association between childhood obesity and adult health outcomes such as diabetes and cardiovascular disease.", "dataset": ["National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey", "National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent to Adult Health"], "topic": ["Health", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the relationship between corruption and foreign direct investment, we combine firm-level data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys with country-level data from the Worldwide Governance Indicators.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Worldwide Governance Indicators"], "topic": ["Governance", "Investment"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the International Monetary Fund's World Economic Outlook database and the World Bank's World Development Indicators to examine the determinants of economic growth in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["International Monetary Fund's World Economic Outlook database", "World Bank's World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses data sources from the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, household surveys, and administrative data on refugee camp populations to explore the relationship between protracted displacement and social welfare outcomes in Lebanon.", "dataset": ["United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees data sources", "household surveys", "administrative data on refugee camp populations"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the Demographic and Health Surveys and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys to assess whether women's exposure to violence is associated with adverse health outcomes for themselves and their children in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys"], "topic": ["Gender", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "Using a nationally representative dataset on U.S. born individuals and immigrants, we investigate the effect of migration on intergenerational mobility and the transmission of parental education and income to children.", "dataset": ["nationally representative dataset on U.S. born individuals and immigrants"], "topic": ["Migration", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This analysis draws on data from the World Bank's Logistics Performance Index and the Enabling Trade Index to examine the relationship between trade facilitation policies and export performance in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Logistics Performance Index", "Enabling Trade Index"], "topic": ["Trade", "Infrastructure"]}]
